fullProgramDescription: The Mechanical Engineering program is designed to provide students with a broad foundation in the principles of mechanical engineering, including the mechanics of solids and fluids, thermodynamics, heat transfer, and mechanical design. The program includes a strong emphasis on laboratory work, computational methods, and design, as well as a range of technical electives that allow students to pursue their individual interests.
shortProgramDescription: The Mechanical Engineering B.S. program provides a comprehensive education in the fundamentals of mechanical engineering, preparing students for a wide range of careers or graduate study.
classHighlights: The program begins with a series of foundational courses in mathematics and physics, including Calculus (MATH20A-B-C-D), Physics (PHYS2A-B-C), and Differential Equations (MATH20D, MATH20E).
Students then move on to core mechanical engineering courses, including Mechanics of Solids and Fluids (MAE101A-B), Thermodynamics (MAE105), and Mechanical Design (MAE101C, MAE107).
Additional required courses include Materials Science (MAE160), Dynamics and Vibrations (MAE130A-B), and Controls (MAE140).
Students also complete a series of laboratory courses, including MAE106L, MAE107L, and MAE131L, which provide hands-on experience with experimental techniques and data analysis.
Technical electives allow students to explore specialized areas, such as aerospace engineering, biomechanical engineering, or energy systems.
Upper-division courses emphasize design, analysis, and problem-solving, with many courses incorporating real-world projects and case studies.
learningOutcomes: Apply fundamental principles of mechanical engineering to analyze and design systems and components.
Demonstrate proficiency in laboratory techniques, data analysis, and experimental methods.
Use computational tools and programming languages to model and simulate mechanical systems.
Design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses and validate models.
Communicate complex technical information effectively in written and oral forms.
Work effectively in teams to solve complex engineering problems.
additionalInformation: The program requires a minimum GPA of2.0 in major courses. Students are encouraged to participate in research, internships, and other extracurricular activities to enhance their educational experience.
